page.title: 01Weeley Coucil Office
page.content: { }The Council Office, east of Weeley was built in 1939. The population has doubled over 50 years.The population of Weeley was 692 in 1931, and 50 years later in 1981 was 1577.In Weeley there were 689 houses in 1981,and also in 1981 there were 408 old age pensioners. In Weeley there are 16 sites for new houses. There is no Mayor in Weeley because it is a district,not a Borough Council. If the chairman of Weeley goes to Colchester Borough, he cannot wear his chain unless he has permission from the Colchester Mayor. Tendring is a Saxon area, and during the war, it had to supply 100 men for the army. Cllr. A. Percy Rayner is the present chairman,and also had this position in 1978, which is very unusual.
